quote_last:
the deacon would come in; he was a lanky young man of twenty-two, with long hair, with no beard and hardly a perceptible mustache. Going into the drawing room, he crossed himself before the ikon, smiled, and held out his hand to Von Koren.
"Good morning," the zoologist said coldly. "Where have you been?"
title: The Duel
author: Anton Pavlovich Chekhov
